properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:39 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-10T02:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T23:15:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3010530676.2020
Area: Kent County, Kouchibouguac National Park

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:46 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. Radar indicates that between 20 mm and 30 mm of rain will fall over the next hour. Potential rainfall rates: in excess of 25 mm/h. Total rainfall: possibly 35 mm. Potential wind gusts:70-90 km/h. Locations: 25 km northwest of St. Quentin, heading south-southeast at 30 km/h to lie near Plaster Rock by 8:45 pm ADT. Time span: ending by 9:30 pm ADT. Remarks:A severe thunderstorm with heavy downpours, followed by small hail and gusty winds will move away from the county in the next hours. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-10T01:45:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-09T22:47:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0531855297.2020
Area: Grand Falls and Victoria County

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain. Potential rainfall rates: 25 mm per hour or higher in thunderstorms. Potential wind gusts: locally 70 km/h or higher in thunderstorms. Locations: Cartwright to Black Tickle. Time span: this evening. Remarks: A strong thunderstorm cell just northwest of Cartwright is moving southeastward at 40 km/h. Localized downpours and gusty winds may accompany this storm cell as it tracks across the region. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:35 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms over the northwest will sweep southeast, giving mainly heavy rain, currently with some small hail. Maximum rainfall rates: in excess of 25 mm/h. Total rainfall: 20 to 50 mm Maximum hail size: near 2 cm. Maximum wind gusts up to 90 km/h : Locations: A line of thunderstorms extending from Neguac southwest to Renous, moving southeast at 45 km/h. Time span: ending by this evening. Remarks: A line of three thunderstorms is moving southeast across Miramichi County, with the highest threat for rainfall amounts, followed by hail, and some gusty winds. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail.
